intro: Mikania sanjacintensis, commonly known as the San Jacinto mikania, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Mikania sanjacintensis is adapted to arid conditions and plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
